Comments_List: Presentation skills and Chinese writing skills

I learned a lot about how to discuss several relevant, important issues in contemporary China, especially issues concerning democracy, Taiwan, and migrant workers. My speaking ability and ability to write characters improved especially. Finally, my grasp of grammatical concepts and ability to discriminate words that have similar, but different meanings increased a lot.
This class really gives you a strong foundation to discuss current issues in China, from the Taiwan political landscape to architecture in Beijing.
I learned many advanced vocabulary and grammar patterns, in addition to insight into Confucianism, the tensions between China and Taiwan, and other current issues in China.
how to read, write, give presentations, and discuss issues in Chinese. learned about various topics like food, architecture, Confucianism, cultural revolution, democracy, and cross-strait relations.
I think that sometimes the daily quizzes were a little difficult to constantly prepare for.
I think having the daily zaoju assignments was an improvement over last semester (154). Its hard to be motivated to do optional exercises, so having homework every day to turn in kept me honest.
This was a very good class. Zhou Laoshi is a wonderful professor who is very flexible with his students. He gives clear assignments and is fair on exams and oral presentations.
the quizzes and assignments are not too demanding but hold you accountable for preparing for class. the vocabulary words and sentence patterns are helpful in writing and reading.
Yes! Does not assume too much of your time but allows you to practice Chinese and get better. Zhou Laoshi is caring, compassionate, and well-informed.
I would recommend this course because it just is such a helpful class and it really strengthened my foundational Chinese.
Yes! Zhou is a great instructor and the course is really fun.
yes, if you want to learn more about political, cultural, and social issues in China and if you want to improve your written and spoken Chinese.
